qas.question: Cells that detect and transmit pain are called what?
Nociceptors were discovered by studying the common what?
Which probe did the larvae react to?

context: At least <a0_0>a few<a0_0/> insects have <a1_0>nociceptors<a1_0/>, cells that detect and transmit sensations of pain. This was discovered in <a2_0>2003<a2_0/> by studying the variation in reactions of larvae of the common <a3_0>fruitfly Drosophila<a3_0/> to the touch of a heated probe and an unheated one. The larvae reacted to the touch of <a4_0>the heated probe<a4_0/> with a stereotypical rolling behavior that was not exhibited when the larvae were touched by the unheated probe. Although nociception has been demonstrated in insects, there is no consensus that insects feel pain consciously
